userMessage: summarize the bmg meetings to date
agentThoughts:
*BMG Meeting Summary*

Based on the notes from *<https://app.attio.com/textql-data/deals/cd30b453-3dd8-420a-b32f-84968b7c5155/overview|BMG Deal>*, here's a comprehensive summary of the BMG meetings to date:

*Key Contact & Context*
- *Primary Contact*: Nico from Global Data Engineering (reports to CTO via IT)
- *Meeting Purpose*: CTO evaluation to assess TextQL's legitimacy and capabilities
- *Status*: Moving quickly with high internal demand

*Organizational Structure*
- *CTO*: Head of IT department
- *Nico's Team*: Global Data Engineering under IT
- *Requesting Teams*: 3 business-facing teams outside of IT have made requests

*Three Interested Teams & Use Cases*

*1. Finance Team*
- *Status*: Already excited after seeing TextQL
- *Use Case*: Budgets vs actuals analysis
- *Priority*: High engagement level

*2. Local Analytics Team (Marketing)*
- *Focus*: Marketing analytics for sales data
- *Current Setup*: Large normalized/denormalized sales data table
- *Need*: Chat interface on top of existing data
- *Assessment*: Nico believes this will be "very easy to implement"

*3. Global Analytics Team*
- *Status*: Expressed interest
- *Use Case*: To be defined

*Implementation Plan*
- *POC Owner*: Nico's team would handle compliance, legal, and IT requirements
- *Process*: Standard data/IT/legal/compliance procedures
- *Timeline*: Fast-moving due to high demand

*Friday CTO Meeting Strategy*
- *Goal*: Clear the "CTO bar" - demonstrate legitimacy and capability
- *Prepared Use Cases*: Sales/marketing analytics, finance budgets vs actuals, plus one additional
- *Attendance*: Nico included but not required (primarily for CTO approval)

*Key Insights*
- Only 1-2 people have seen TextQL so far, yet demand is already high
- Multiple teams independently requesting evaluation
- Strong early enthusiasm from finance team
- Nico surprised by rapid momentum and interest level

The meetings indicate strong product-market fit with multiple use cases and rapid internal adoption potential at BMG.

0.name: BMG
0.description: BMG is a leading international music company specializing in music publishing and recording rights, prioritizing the needs of artists and songwriters to help them succeed in their careers.

  3. Finance Team

- Nico reports to IT/Global Data Engineering under CTO
- Finance team and local Anthropic team showed excitement
- Marketing analytics use case: Chat interface for sales data analysis
- Nico has shared with 1-2 people, noting rapid interest growth
- If POC proceeds, Nico's team would handle compliance/legal/IT requirements

Next Steps:

  * Sales/Marketing analytics use case
  * Finance (budgets vs actuals)
  * One additional use case

2.title: Note from Slack
2.content:
CTO Meeting Prep - Call Summary with Nico

Key Points:
- 3 teams outside IT have requested our product:
  1. Global Analytics Team
  2. Local Analytics/Marketing Team
  3. Finance Team

- Organizational Structure:
  - Nico reports to CTO (IT/Global Data Engineering)
  - CTO heads IT department
  - Local analytics focuses on marketing/sales data analysis

- Current Status:
  - Nico has shared with finance team (positive response)
  - Local analytics team interested in chat interface for sales data
  - Moving quickly with high demand

- Next Steps:
  - Friday CTO meeting to validate solution
  - Nico's team would handle compliance/legal if POC proceeds
  - Focus on sales/marketing analytics, finance (budgets vs actuals) use cases

Note: Nico doesn't need to attend Friday's CTO meeting as it's primarily for technical validation.

3.title: BMG conversation with Nico
3.content:
for the BMG call tmr morning Do an update. Okay. This is just for note taking because I just finished the call, with Nico. For the CTO conversation with BMG on Friday. There are 3 teams that have requested this. They set all outside of IT. CTO is head of IT. And IT is where Nico reports into, which is global data engineering. Separately, there is a global analytics team and then there is a local analytics team, and then there is a finance team, all 3 of whom have expressed interest in our products. Nico has reached out, like, shared our link with, like, one of those finance teams. The finance team was excited. Some local Anthropic team was excited. Local analytics here seems to be synonymous with marketing. Marketing analytics, which is just like going through their sales data in, like, a very normalized, like, one big or denormalized one big table inside format, and just has a chat on top, which I think he thinks is gonna be, like, very easy to do. Separately, But yeah. So these are these are the some of the things there. And then, and then that's that's so the 3 the 3 more business facing teams have basically made this request for, for the CTO to, kinda look into it, to see, are we full of shit? Are we, like, kinda good? That's, like, the meta of this. So those are the 3 use cases, that we've kind of talked through and talked about about. Nico has only shared it with 1 or 2 people, so he's very surprised His perspective right now is that it's moving very quickly Claude there's so much demand for this. And yeah. You know, I'll include him on the call, but he doesn't need to be there because the most part, we're just clearing the CTO bar. Separately, Nico is the team that if we were to start a POC, would be picking up all the compliance, all the shit Like, right, it's the standard, like, data is actually a, like, a IT slash legal slash compliance team. Like, type bullshit. Yep. That's, that's that's the that was the summary that Nico gave us, and, we should go into this Friday call with a with a sales, marketing analytics use case with the finance, like budgets versus actuals thing. And maybe one more. Alright. Cool.

Priority: High (already engaged)

Focus: Sales data analysis
Current Setup: One large normalized/denormalized table

Note: Nico thinks this will be "very easy to do"

9:50
Ethan Ding
We just finished a call with Nico from BMG's Global Data Engineering team (which reports to the CTO through IT) regarding our Friday CTO meeting. Three business-facing teams outside of IT have requested that the CTO evaluate our products: a finance team (interested in budgets vs. actuals analysis), a local analytics team focused on marketing analytics (they want a chat interface on top of their normalized sales data table), and a global analytics team. Nico has already shared our link with one of the finance teams, who responded enthusiastically, and he's surprised by how quickly this is moving due to high demand. The Friday call is essentially a "CTO bar" evaluation where we need to demonstrate legitimacy and capability to the head of IT. For the call, we should prepare use cases around sales/marketing analytics, finance budgets vs. actuals, and potentially a third use case. If we move forward with a POC, Nico's team would handle all the compliance, legal, and IT requirements, as they're the standard data/IT/legal/compliance team for these types of implementations.
